attributes.action: EU legislation publicly debated & voted on before going before EU Parliament
attributes.additional_details: The people have the legal right to debate, vote and agree or disagree to all and any legislative laws, articles or agreements  made by the EU Parliament
attributes.background: The EU make decisions and legislative law that effects everyone in every member state yet the people have no choice or say in any of these matters, it is against the human rights of the people not to be consulted before being put before the EU parliament.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

In any case, the EU process of decision making is a matter for the EU, not the UK Government or Parliament. You could start a new petition about this issue with the European Parliament, which has its own petitions system:

http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/20150201PVL00037/Petitions

You could also start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
